Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Talent has been engaged by our Financial Services client to recruit for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team on an initial 6-month daily rate contract with the view to extend or move permanent.

Our client is a highly respected Australian brand who are focused on growth and innovation, and have a strong track record of expanding their capabilities and market presence.

This position is based in the Sydney CBD with 2-3 days in the office.

This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst with experience in Investments or Wealth management to help define the future state target design for the organisation.

Key Responsibilities:

Contribute to the design and delivery of the organisation's future state target design
Analyse current processes and identify opportunities to improve systems and workflows
Run scrums and manage UAT testing
Embed knowledge and processes into the environment to ensure successful productionisation
Work closely with senior stakeholders, including C-Suite executives, to deliver outcomes
Ensure the quality of use cases is sufficient to achieve successful releases

To be successful in this role, you will have experience in:

10 - 15 year's experience as a Business Analyst (Must be in financial services)
Investments/ Wealth Management/ experience is a Must
Strong experience working with stakeholders at all levels, including senior leadership
Proven ability to work in an agile environment, running scrums and managing use cases
Excellent communication skills and ability to influence change
AI experience is a plus (supporting data sets and proof of concept use cases)

If this is sounds like the role for you, please apply now. For a confidential discussion, please reach out to Josh.costigan@talentinternational.com

As a Data and Insight Analyst at Silverchain working within the Research and Innovation division you will be responsible for supporting the implementation, maintenance and support of data analytics, insight projects, data science and data visualisations. Working collaboratively within the team and with stakeholders from across the business, this role ensures the delivery of data, reports and insights in line with business priorities.

What's on offer

Fulltime permanent role. Monday-Friday 76 hours per fortnight.
Hybrid role - working from home and at our office in Osborne Park.
Working for a non-profit organisation, you can salary package up to $18,500 tax free.
Everyday discounts, including discounted vouchers for Coles, Woolworths, Amazon, Myer, The Good Guys and more.
Comprehensive health and wellbeing resources and support.

What we're looking for

Qualifications in relevant discipline: Business, Leadership, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics.
A deep understanding of at least part of the lifecycle of developing reports, analytics and insights.
Knowledge of relational database management systems to capture and utilise data.
Knowledge of data science and other contemporary analytical techniques.
Experience in leading engagements with senior stakeholders to develop actionable insights from disperse data and analysis.
Experience in data visualisation technologies such as Power BI.
Experience in the use of data profiling techniques to analyse data from source systems.
Experience across the full development data and reporting lifecycle (covering requirements, design implementation, testing, etc)
Experience in Lean and Agile delivery framework with a flexible and adaptable approach to work.

The role

As a Data and Insight Analyst you will:

Leverage tools like SQL, R, Python, DAX, and Power BI to analyse and visualise large datasets, uncover trends, and deliver actionable insights.
Design, develop, and maintain reproducible data pipelines using R, Python, and SQL to streamline data dissemination across diverse collections.
Develop clear, compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI. Use DAX to craft intelligent calculations and model both structured and unstructured data to support strategic decisions.
Advocate for strong data governance practices and help enforce data standards that elevate the integrity and usability of our data assets.
Ensure thorough documentation of functional and non-functional requirements, design specifications, and technical processes to support transparency and scalability.

Why choose Silverchain

Everyone at Silverchain, from our care teams to leadership, plays a vital role in delivering Best Care. It's a team effort. Best Care is care that is safe, personal, connected and effective.

We are proudly one of the few Australian home care providers accredited in both national health and aged care standards. This means the quality of care we provide is expected to meet the same standards as a hospital or residential aged care facility.

As a not-for-profit organisation, we re-invest our funds into research and developing innovative models of care to set the industry benchmark for the provision of the best care in the home.

We'll also provide you with opportunities to help you develop and grow in your career, with training and education programs to help you achieve your goals

How to apply

To submit your application, click ‘Apply'.

At Silverchain, we recognise the positive contribution that a diverse workforce makes to our organisation where individuals can be authentic, are respected and celebrated. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people of all ages, gender, abilities, culturally diverse and linguistic backgrounds.

Category:
Programme & Project Management (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
What you'll do

Lead the development of the workforce reporting strategy to support organisational workforce reporting including identifying and researching human resources issues and contributing information and recommendations to organisational strategic thinking.
Manage the development, enhancement and implementation of performance reporting function to provideaccurate and timely performance reports to internal and external stakeholders.
Design and implement contemporary reporting tools and methodologies, such as dashboards, reporting, trending and predictive analytics that are responsive to users needs, delivering actionable insights that support HR strategies, policies, practices and systems and inform business decision making.
Partner with key stakeholders and human resources leaders to uncover data driven workforce insights, communicate trends and ensure alignment with organisational objectives and the broader public sector.
Drive continuous improvement by leveraging technology and reporting tools to ensure automated and replicable data outcomes and develop sophisticated solutions to complex, system-wide issues.
Work closely with other HR data teams to ensure alignment with data governance practices and embed these into the work of the Reporting and Analytics team through technical design and user access.
Work with key stakeholders to develop and document standardised workforce metrics and embed these within performance reports.
Prepare high quality and complex reports, submissions, briefing notes and correspondence including ministerial briefs, questions on notice, parliamentary briefs and cabinet submissions.

About you

We are searching for someone with:

Demonstrated knowledge and commitment to industry best practice, including knowledge of contemporary approaches to strategic human resources concepts, practices, HR reporting, analytics, statistical analysis and metrics to achieve positive measurable business results.(SFIA: METL Level 5).
Highly developed research, analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills including proven capacity to initiate appropriate strategic and operational responses to key issues relating to performance, trending and predictive projections to inform executive decision making and early intervention.(SFIA: BINT Level 5).
Demonstrated high level ability to analyse, prepare and present complex data driven recommendations, reports and submissions and to effectively communicate and negotiate outcomes at the highest level. (SFIA: CNSL Level 5).
Demonstrated ability to lead, coach, inspire and drive a team of diverse employees. (SFIA: PEMT Level 5).

Why work with us?

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes

Competitive salaries

12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading

Employee wellbeing

36.25 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.

Professional development

Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.
Grow your skills through hands-on experience and access to internal training opportunities and additional financial and leave benefits for approved external training and development.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion 

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions. 

Ready to apply?

For further information on how to apply please review the attached Role Description.

Senior Manager - Portfolio Performance - Banking

Developing and managing relationships within the business unit and across the retail banking community, your primary focus will be ensuring quality information is provided to optimise decision-making processes. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders to drive continuous improvement initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:

Drive strategic planning for the QBR's using OKR to portfolio processes 
Oversee resource allocation.
Ensure adoption of industry-leading methodologies and technology frameworks.
Enhance reporting quality and operational controls to mitigate risks effectively.
Provide training and guidance to ensure successful organisational changes.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to manage cross-cutting initiatives effectively.
Drive strategic planning processes and oversee resource allocation.
Analyse data sets to identify potential risks and issues.
Deliver insightful reports to drive actionable outcomes.
What We're Looking For:

Experience as a Senior Manager or Manager from a consultancy or a large bank who has worked on quarterly business reviews, objective key results and portfolio management.
Resource strategy and allocation
Passion for internal investment yield improvement.
Interest in shaping the future of retail banking.
Strong commercial acumen and financial management experience.
Previous experience in Financial Services needed
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proven track record in stakeholder management.
Perks:

Permanent role with opportunities for career development and succession planning.
Hybrid work model with an office located in Sydney.
If you possess the above skill set and are eager to make a significant impact in the retail banking industry please apply with your updated resume.

Andrew

CRM & Billing Transformation Program
Initial Contract - January start,  3 months with extension
Hybrid Working Model

We’re looking for a Change Communications specialist to support a major CRM & Billing transformation program. This role is hands-on and delivery focused, owning the communication planning and execution needed to guide teams through significant technology and process change.

What you’ll be doing:

Develop clear, engaging, and timely communications that support the rollout of new systems and ways of working.
Translate complex technical changes into simple, user-friendly messages.
Support the broader change team by delivering comms plans, stakeholder updates, newsletters, FAQs, and go-live communications.
Work closely with project teams, SMEs, and business leaders to understand impacts and craft communication materials that drive awareness and adoption.
Help manage feedback channels, pulse checks, and readiness communications across the program.
What you’ll bring:

Strong experience in change communications within large technology or transformation projects.
Ability to write clear, engaging, and tailored communications for different audiences.
Experience working in complex environments with multiple stakeholders.
Knowledge of change management practices and frameworks.
A proactive, delivery-focused mindset with excellent attention to detail.
If this sounds like you, CLICK APPLY.
For more information, contact Dominic Elliott – dominic@justdigitalpeople.com.au

Join this Queensland Government department as an experienced Dynamics 365 Functional Analyst supporting the delivery of a major digital transformation initiative. Starting January 2026, this Brisbane-based contract runs through to September 2026, with strong potential for extension. This role offers hybrid work arrangements, however applicants must be located in Brisbane.

About the Opportunity
You will join a high-impact program modernising how the department manages resource authority processes across Queensland. Working within a collaborative, delivery-focused team, you’ll help shape and optimise the organisation’s Dynamics 365 platform, improving user experience and ensuring long-term sustainability.

Key Responsibilities
Work closely with business stakeholders to interpret needs and translate them into clear, structured build requirements.
Configure Dynamics 365 and support the delivery of a scalable, future-ready solution.
Prepare technical documentation, diagrams, and Business Process Flows.
Support data migration planning and execution from legacy systems.
Lead and participate in testing activities, including end-to-end test execution.
Develop training materials and deliver user training.
Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and enhancements post-implementation.
Stay current with new Dynamics 365 features, recommending improvements where appropriate.
About You
To succeed in this role, you will bring:

5+ years’ experience as a Dynamics 365 Functional Analyst on large ICT programs.
Strong capability in business process analysis and solution design.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage non-technical stakeholders.
Experience creating workflow diagrams and re-engineering business processes.
The ability to work autonomously while contributing effectively within a multi-disciplinary team.
Highly regarded:

Degree qualifications in IT, Business or similar.
Dynamics 365 certifications.
Experience with Customer Service, Customer Insights – Journeys, and Project Operations.
Proficiency in BPMN 2.0.
Apply immediately for consideration.

Graham Eather - graham.eather@troocoo.com
Jayde Elliott - jayde.elliott@troocoo.com

Head of Strategy and Delivery  



$250k - $280k + super + bonus

Macquarie Park / Hybrid

Permanent Position


About the role:
This senior strategic position sits at the centre of a business undergoing significant growth, commercial expansion, and organisational uplift. The Strategy and Delivery function has broadened substantially, and the organisation now requires a seasoned leader who can take full ownership of enterprise strategy, delivery governance, and business-wide change. You will guide the annual strategy cycle, shape commercial priorities, and ensure complex initiatives are clearly defined, well-governed, and executed with discipline. The environment includes large transformation programs, product and process evolution, and growing interest in adjacent markets such as asset leasing, fleet solutions, and customer-facing mobility products. The role also carries accountability for leading M&A assessments and due diligence, requiring strong commercial judgement and comfort working directly with senior executives.

 

Key responsibilities:
• Lead enterprise strategic planning, market and competitor analysis, and identification of growth opportunities.
• Drive and embed strategy, delivery, and change frameworks across all business functions.
• Challenge assumptions, test commercial viability, and elevate strategic thinking across the organisation.
• Provide rigorous commercial insights through financial modelling, business case development, and strategic recommendations.
• Oversee governance, prioritisation, and delivery of cross-functional programs and initiatives.
• Bring clarity and structure to complex environments with multiple competing priorities.
• Review existing workstreams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives and effective execution.
• Lead M&A assessments including target identification, strategic fit analysis, commercial evaluation, and due diligence.
• Influence senior stakeholders, ensuring alignment, challenge, and strategic discipline at executive level.
• Support organisation-wide change and adoption in partnership with People & Culture.
• Build strategy, delivery, and change maturity across teams through uplift, coaching, and structured frameworks.
• Oversee pilot programs and innovation trials, ensuring commercial outcomes and effective integration into the core business.

 

Skills, Experience, and Attributes:
• 10+ years’ experience across strategy, transformation, delivery, or enterprise-level change.
• Strong commercial acumen including financial modelling, commercial analysis, and evaluation of investment decisions.
• M&A experience essential, with exposure to due diligence, valuation considerations, and integration planning.
• Background in consulting, corporate strategy, financial services, or other complex, capital-intensive environments.
• Experience within fleet management, asset leasing, or novated leasing highly beneficial due to the commercial, operational, and regulatory dynamics of the sector.
• Ability to influence senior executives and drive organisation-wide alignment.
• Skilled at leading cross-functional teams and uplifting strategy, delivery, and change capability.
• Strong structured problem-solving, analytical capability, and clarity in communication.
• Ability to move seamlessly between strategic thinking, hands-on delivery, and change leadership.
• Confident facilitating workshops, driving engagement, and challenging thinking to develop new ideas and strategic directions.
• Calm, methodical leadership style capable of bringing order and discipline to a fast-moving and evolving environment.
• Experience with new product development, commercial pilots, or innovation programs advantageous.

Our client is seeking a Finance Business Partner who excels at turning data into actionable decisions. This role sits at the heart of Commercial Finance, owning reporting, refining forecasts, and partnering with leaders to enhance transparency and drive performance across the business.

The successful candidate will collaborate closely with senior leadership and stakeholders to enhance transparency of business performance, deliver meaningful insights and strengthen forecasting and planning capabilities.

Key Accountabilities

Close with confidence: Deliver timely month-end close and accurate financial reporting.
Own the numbers: Lead bottom-up budgeting and forecasting aligned with business goals.
Explain performance: Monitor results against budget and forecast, providing clear, actionable insights.
Partner strategically: Work with senior leaders to highlight the metrics that matter.
Turn insight into action: Identify trends, uncover improvement opportunities, and support pricing & cost analysis with Sales, Operations, and support teams.
Go beyond reporting: Use BI tools (Power BI preferred) for predictive and real-time decision-making.
Drive improvement: Enhance processes and efficiency across finance and operations.
Set the standard: Champion best practices in financial governance and reporting.

Key Selection Criteria

Analytical & commercial mindset: Ability to interpret financial data and provide strategic insights.
Process improvement expertise: Experience in automation, system enhancements, and efficiency initiatives.
Collaborative & organised: Builds strong cross-functional relationships and manages priorities under pressure.
High-quality reporting: Maintains rigorous standards with excellent verbal and written communication.
Accounting proficiency: Strong technical knowledge, including statutory compliance and relevant laws.
Systems savvy: ERP experience (SAP preferred) and BI tools (Power BI); intermediate to advanced Excel.
Qualified & credentialed: Degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA/CA (or progressing).
Adaptable & proactive: Self-motivated and flexible in response to changing business needs.

Why you'll love it here

Global company with a small business feel.
Locally manufactured products.Strong focus on culture and people.
Competitive remuneration package including profit shares.
Flexible working conditions and family first approach.
Regular social events including Christmas parties.
Additional leave entitlements, paid parental leave gap payments, option to purchase leave.
Access to Employee Assistance Program & discount offers.
Award nomination program.
Professional development opportunities.

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team where your insights will directly influence business performance.

For further information, please contact kayla.cittadini@persolapac.com

Who are we?

PERSOL APAC is one of Australia and New Zealand's leading staffing and recruitment providers.
Since 1946, our staff have taken fresh thinking and an innovative approach to lead in a constantly changing world. The team here at PERSOL APAC aim to attract the right staff and find the best possible outcome for your career or business.

The Organisation: A retail organisation based in Sydney is looking for hands-on data leader (50-50) to own and execute on a multi-year data roadmap through the delivery of high-impact analytics and data solutions. Reporting into the CIO, you will play an important role in enabling data-driven decision-making across the organisation. This is the ideal role for someone who can think about the bigger picture and contribute with hands-on technical delivery. You will be based in Sydney and able to work in the office a minimum of 3 days per week. 

Key Priorities of the Role:

Build strong stakeholder relationships and be a trusted delivery partner by translating data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision making.  
Partner with C-Suite & ELT across Marketing, Finance, Retail & Operations to understand their requirements and translate into actionable data solutions. 
Hands-on delivery of these data solutions, ensuring adherence to best practices whilst leading a hybrid team consisting of one internal senior data engineer and an external delivery partner.
Ideally you have a data engineering background with expertise in Snowflake along with data modeling & ETL (dbt) & orchestration (airflow), Python, SQL, Power BI.
CI/CD & Jira or similar.
Apply & develop your knowledge of emerging technologies and AI tools such as Claude, Snowflake Cortex, NLPs, LLMs & automation.
Collaborate with data engineering, architecture & reporting colleagues to design, develop and implement these solutions whilst providing mentorship & guidance towards continuous improvement and knowledge sharing.
Your Skillset:

Demonstrated experience in leading a small data team whilst remaining hands-on in design & development of data solutions (50-50).
Strong data engineering background with progression into leading a team.
Hands-on experience in Snowflake DWH, SQL (SSAS), Airflow, DBT, Python, CI/CD, Power BI.
AI tools such as Claude, Snowflake Cortex & ML & NLPs.
Data lake architecture, strong multi-dimensional data modeling, real-time data streaming & EDD.
Enjoy business partnering with key stakeholders and C-Suite - become a trusted advisor to multiple business & operational teams.
Passion for continuous improvement & open to new tools & technologies.
Collaborative and mentoring leadership style.
Retail or FMCG experience highly regarded.
You must have Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency to be considered for this role and be Sydney based. Please apply below for immediate consideration.

TheDriveGroup has partnered with a well known Australian brand who are looking for 3 Business Process Analysts. One located in 3 different cities Brisbane, Melbourne, and Sydney. They need strong Business Analysts who can review and document current state compliance and communicate with operational and technical teams. Someone who can offer potential technology improvements such as integration or system improvement opportunities. to Be successful you MUST HAVE:


Business Analyst
Process mapping and Process Improvement initiatives
Strong capability in documenting current state, developing proposed future state, and building recommendations
Strong Communication Skills
Exposure to lean, continuous improvement, or process simplification methodologies
Strong Stakeholder Management Skills
Technical literacy to identify system integrations or digital improvements
This role will require some in office workshops but mostly worked remote across the three locations stated. There will be a two stage interview process with ideally a January start. If you can hit the ground running and looking for a new role the HIT APPLY

Company description:



About us

Established in 1840, we are Australia's first wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services for our members and the community.

As a social enterprise, we're motivated by our purpose to positively impact the wellbeing of millions. We reinvest profits to deliver products and services sustainably that matter most to our members, customers and the Australian community.

For us, Real Wellbeing encompasses the whole experience of life. It's about feeling supported in your health, connected with your community and empowered to live life on your terms.



Job description:



Your New Role Looks Like This:

We have an exciting 12-month fixed-term opportunity for a Senior Payroll & HR Business Analyst to join our team and make a real impact on a major workforce initiative.

In this role, you will be responsible for providing critical analysis and insights to support the review and implementation of changes that are anticipated across industry. This position combines analytical expertise with stakeholder collaboration to deliver outcomes that meet compliance and organisational objectives.

The project involves the assessment and review of Home Health workforce, commercial assessment and workforce consideration to enable the development and implementation of a new suite of Home Health Enterprise Agreements (EAs). The project will assess current entitlements, financial impacts, and system implementation requirements to support the implementation of the new agreements.

Conduct detailed financial analysis of current and proposed EA terms.
Develop and maintain data models to support costing scenarios.
Analyse and model classification grades, rates, and penalty structures.
Collaborate with HR, Payroll, and Finance teams to assess cost implications of new entitlements.
Support the implementation of updated EAs into payroll systems.
Assist in systemising new entitlements and ensuring compliance with legislative and organisational standards.
Provide reporting and insights to support decision-making and negotiations.

About You:

Strong background in financial analysis and data modelling.
Experience with EA interpretation, especially in payroll or HR contexts.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, or similar analytical tools.
Understanding of award interpretation, penalty rates, and industrial relations frameworks.
Experience in system implementation or configuration (HRIS/Payroll and Time & Attendance systems).
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.
Prior experience working on EA projects or industrial relations initiatives is ideal.
Familiarity with EAs in sectors like healthcare, aged care, hospitality, or government.
Ability to work independently and manage competing priorities.


What's on Offer:

You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:

Competitive salary + bonus program
Enjoy additional yearly Well-Being and Community leave days
14-week paid parental leave, with equal benefit for both parents
Employee Referral Program
Employee Assistance Program - support and assistance for you and your partner at those times in life when you need it most
Maxxia Rewards - a great range of discounts and benefits at selected retail outlets, department stores, attractions, travel, cinemas, restaurants.
Discounts across the Australian Unity business including Private Health Insurance, General Insurance + more!
Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform

For further benefits visit: https://www.australianunity.com.au/careers/culture

Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.

Job Title: Principal Solution Architect - Artificial Intelligence Solutions
Ad Text:
Join a future-focused, innovative team driving digital transformation. NEC is a global leader in technology and communications solutions. As part of our growth, we’re looking for a passionate and experienced Principal Solution Architect – Artificial Intelligence (AI) Solutions to lead the strategic development and execution of AI products and solutions in the Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) markets.




This role is pivotal in supporting the company’s vision and ensuring that our use of AI and offerings meet the evolving needs of our business across various use cases and applications. The successful candidate will work closely with internal teams, clients, and vendors to architect and enhance AI solutions, driving innovation and compliance with industry standards.




Key Accountabilities

 

Vision and Strategy Development: Support the company's vision by developing strategic plans for internal adoption of AI and our product landscape, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.

Business Engagement: Engage within NEC (ANZ & global) and clients, defining roadmaps for the adoption and implementation of AI services. Apply a customer-centric approach to all aspects of work.

Product Architecture: Architect and collaborate on the application and integration of AI to enhance our digital and managed service offerings.

AI Ethics and Responsible Use: Exercise an awareness of potential biases in AI systems and the ability to apply governance frameworks and privacy standards to ensure fair and responsible use.

Vendor Collaboration: Work closely with our vendors to promote and drive AI solutions across the ANZ region, and internally.

Architecture Leadership: Provide architecture leadership to internal teams, guiding the development of consistent, high-quality AI architectures that meet business outcomes and comply with industry standards and security requirements. Function as Technical Lead during the development process while providing solution design and accurate cost inputs for proposals and business cases.

Advisory Role: Serve as a trusted advisor to Heads of and C-level executives, leading strategic, transitional, and target state architectures to drive the success of the company's AI adoption and evolution of modern services.

 

What You’ll Bring

 We’re looking for someone with a strong technical background and leadership experience:

Significant experience in AI solutions, product architecture, and integration strategies.

Strong understanding of the ANZ market, including regulatory and compliance requirements.

Demonstrated ability to work with clients, vendors, and teams to deliver innovative solutions.

Leadership skills with experience in guiding teams and influencing C-level executives.

Knowledge of industry best practices, standards, and security requirements related to AI.

Excellent communication, strategic planning, and project management skills.

Strong commercial acumen

Degree or relevant qualification in IT

Certifications in AWS, Microsoft Azure preferred

 

Why NEC?

Be part of a global, purpose-driven company at the forefront of innovation.

Lead impactful projects that drive Artificial Intelligence and our product landscape.

Work in a collaborative, inclusive, and forward-thinking environment.

Opportunities for career growth, mentoring, and skill development.




Please apply now.

As part of our growth, we’re looking for a passionate and experienced Principal Solution Architect – Artificial Intelligence (AI) Solutions to lead the strategic development and execution of AI products and solutions in the Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) markets.




This role is pivotal in supporting the company’s vision and ensuring that our use of AI and offerings meet the evolving needs of our business across various use cases and applications. The successful candidate will work closely with internal teams, clients, and vendors to architect and enhance AI solutions, driving innovation and compliance with industry standards.




Key Accountabilities

 

Vision and Strategy Development: Support the company's vision by developing strategic plans for internal adoption of AI and our product landscape, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.

Business Engagement: Engage within NEC (ANZ & global) and clients, defining roadmaps for the adoption and implementation of AI services. Apply a customer-centric approach to all aspects of work.

Product Architecture: Architect and collaborate on the application and integration of AI to enhance our digital and managed service offerings.

AI Ethics and Responsible Use: Exercise an awareness of potential biases in AI systems and the ability to apply governance frameworks and privacy standards to ensure fair and responsible use.

Vendor Collaboration: Work closely with our vendors to promote and drive AI solutions across the ANZ region, and internally.

Architecture Leadership: Provide architecture leadership to internal teams, guiding the development of consistent, high-quality AI architectures that meet business outcomes and comply with industry standards and security requirements. Function as Technical Lead during the development process while providing solution design and accurate cost inputs for proposals and business cases.

Advisory Role: Serve as a trusted advisor to Heads of and C-level executives, leading strategic, transitional, and target state architectures to drive the success of the company's AI adoption and evolution of modern services.

 

What You’ll Bring

 We’re looking for someone with a strong technical background and leadership experience:

Significant experience in AI solutions, product architecture, and integration strategies.

Strong understanding of the ANZ market, including regulatory and compliance requirements.

Demonstrated ability to work with clients, vendors, and teams to deliver innovative solutions.

Leadership skills with experience in guiding teams and influencing C-level executives.

Knowledge of industry best practices, standards, and security requirements related to AI.

Excellent communication, strategic planning, and project management skills.

Strong commercial acumen

Degree or relevant qualification in IT

Certifications in AWS, Microsoft Azure preferred

 

Why NEC?

Be part of a global, purpose-driven company at the forefront of innovation.

Lead impactful projects that drive Artificial Intelligence and our product landscape.

Work in a collaborative, inclusive, and forward-thinking environment.

Opportunities for career growth, mentoring, and skill development.




Please apply now.

Job Title: Senior Lecturer in Business Information Systems
Ad Text:
Classification: Academic Level C
Salary package: $146,007 - $162,281 per annum plus 17% superannuation 

Terms: Full time, Continuing

Position Description and Selection Criteria: PD & PEWER Level C Senior Lecturer in Business Information Systems.pdf



Position overview 

The Research School of Management in the ANU College of Business and Economics aims to create and share management knowledge that makes a difference to organisations and society. Nine academics with affiliations to our School are listed among the 2025 Stanford/Elsevier Top 2% Scientists.

To continue the current growth trajectory, we are seeking to recruit a Senior Lecturer (Level C) in the field of Business Information Systems. The successful applicant will conduct research of international standing and actively contribute to undergraduate and postgraduate teaching in the School. They will have a strong work ethic, a practical approach, and be passionate about the quality of their work. The successful applicant will join a strong team of academics who publish in top international journals and hold external competitive grants. The School and College provide an excellent research environment, including favourable teaching load and internal research support. 

The position is open to international applicants. The successful applicant must be available to commence work in Canberra, Australia by mid-2026. The successful applicant will be offered relocation assistance as per ANU Policy.

We have a strong equal opportunity culture. We encourage all applicants particularly, female, Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander applicants. 

For further information, please contact Associate Professor Ashkan Zarghami, E: ashkan.zarghami@anu.edu.au

College overview 

The Australian National University (ANU) is one of the world’s great universities, ranking 32nd in the 2026 QS World University Rankings. The Research School of Management sits within the ANU College of Business and Economics. The College educates the next generation of business leaders, professional economists and academics. Our graduates have the knowledge and skills to lead organisations, design public policy, and research the big issues of business and economy.

Located in the national capital, we engage deeply with the business and policy communities. Our academics lead public debate on the critical issues of our time through their research, which is both long term and strategic in focus. Our internationally diverse student body is evenly divided between undergraduate and postgraduate study, and we have a large doctoral program. Our alumni are found in the world's leading companies, policy agencies and universities. 

We strongly believe that the way in which we operate is defined by our Values and Behaviours and encourage you to apply if you are looking for a workplace that encourages respect, collegiality and excellence. 

The University actively encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. For more information on employment opportunities, contact our Indigenous Employment Consultant on indigenous.employment@anu.edu.au.

ANU values diversity and inclusion and believes employment opportunities must not be limited by socio-economic background, race, religion or gender. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/business-units/human-resources-division/equity-and-diversity 

Application information

In order to apply for this role please make sure that you upload the following documents:

A statement (3 pages max) addressing the selection criteria.
A current curriculum vitae (CV) which includes the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). If your CV does not include referees you can complete these online when prompted in the application form.
Other documents, if required.

Applications which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position.

Please note: The successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check during the recruitment process.  An offer of employment is conditional on satisfactory results.

 Closing date: Thursday, 15 January 2026, 11.55 (Canberra Time)
